title: Jawhara (Moroccan Orange and Almond Cake)
description: An exquisite, moist almond cake soaked in orange syrup, known for its luxurious texture and vibrant citrus flavor.
instructions: Wash oranges thoroughly. Place whole oranges in a pot, cover with water, and boil for 2 hours until very soft. Drain and let cool completely.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease and line a 9-inch round cake pan with parchment paper.
Cut cooled oranges into quarters, remove any seeds, then blend entire oranges (skin and all) into a smooth puree.
In a large bowl, whisk together ground almonds, semolina, flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs with sugar until pale and thick. Gradually add oil while continuing to beat.
Add orange puree and 2 tbsp orange blossom water to egg mixture, mixing well.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined. Do not overmix.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until a skewer comes out clean.

While cake bakes, make syrup: Combine 200g sugar, 250ml water, and lemon juice in a saucepan. Bring to boil, then simmer for 10 minutes until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in 1 tbsp orange blossom water.
As soon as cake comes out of oven, pour hot syrup evenly over the hot cake. Let cake cool completely in the pan.
Garnish with toasted almond flakes and orange zest before serving.
